bitReport 0.1.5.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    bitR color grey

    bit_grey.Rd

    bit_grey provides the preferred color of bit_pal_grey (as an atomic HEX character value) and is defined as bit_pal_grey[[4]].

    See https://media.unhcr.org/archive/Brand-Book-for-external-partners-2CZ7A2P0CGAY.html for details.

    bit_grey

    Format

    An object of class character of length 1.

    See also

    bit_pal_grey for the corresponding color palette; bit_pal for the bitR default color palette with 5 main colors of bit_pal_blue; bit_pal_primary for a bitR color palette with primary colors; seecol to show and use color palettes.

    Other preferred colors: bit_black, bit_blue, bit_darkblue, bit_green, bit_red, bit_white, bit_yellow

    Examples

    {
bit_grey  # HEX character "#666666" (as value)
all.equal(bit_grey, bit_pal_grey[[4]])  # TRUE (same HEX values)

seecol(bit_grey)  # view color and details
}
